title: Wheelchair Tennis Champions Face Defeats in Australian Open
summary: In the Australian Open wheelchair tennis events, defending champion Alfie Hewett, a top-seeded British player with 10 Grand Slam singles titles, was defeated in the semi-finals by Spain's Martin de la Puente with a score of 6-4, 6-4 in one hour and 27 minutes. This ended Hewett's title defence after his wins in 2023 and 2025. Earlier, Hewett and his partner Gordon Reid lost in the men's doubles semi-finals to Tokito Oda and Gustavo Fernandez, missing a chance for a seventh consecutive title. In the quad doubles, British player Andy Lapthorne, a 16-time Grand Slam doubles champion, lost in the final to top seeds Guy Sasson and Niels Vink alongside his partner Heath Davidson, ending his bid for a third straight title. The article highlights these upsets and sets up the final between de la Puente and 2024 champion Tokito Oda, while also noting other tennis news briefly.
